speaker: Hecate
text: Have I not reason, beldams as you are?

speaker: Hecate
text: Saucy and overbold, how did you dare

speaker: Hecate
text: To trade and traffic with Macbeth

speaker: Hecate
text: In riddles and affairs of death,

speaker: Hecate
text: And I, the mistress of your charms,

speaker: Hecate
text: The close contriver of all harms,

speaker: Hecate
text: Was never called to bear my part

speaker: Hecate
text: Or show the glory of our art?

speaker: Hecate
text: And which is worse, all you have done

speaker: Hecate
text: Hath been but for a wayward son,

speaker: Hecate
text: Spiteful and wrathful, who, as others do,

speaker: Hecate
text: Loves for his own ends, not for you.

speaker: Hecate
text: But make amends now. Get you gone,

speaker: Hecate
text: And at the pit of Acheron

speaker: Hecate
text: Meet me i’ th’ morning. Thither he

speaker: Hecate
text: Will come to know his destiny.

speaker: Hecate
text: Your vessels and your spells provide,

speaker: Hecate
text: Your charms and everything beside.

speaker: Hecate
text: I am for th’ air. This night I’ll spend

speaker: Hecate
text: Unto a dismal and a fatal end.

speaker: Hecate
text: Great business must be wrought ere noon.

speaker: Hecate
text: Upon the corner of the moon

speaker: Hecate
text: There hangs a vap’rous drop profound.

speaker: Hecate
text: I’ll catch it ere it come to ground,

speaker: Hecate
text: And that, distilled by magic sleights,

speaker: Hecate
text: Shall raise such artificial sprites

speaker: Hecate
text: As by the strength of their illusion

speaker: Hecate
text: Shall draw him on to his confusion.

speaker: Hecate
text: He shall spurn fate, scorn death, and bear

speaker: Hecate
text: His hopes ’bove wisdom, grace, and fear.

speaker: Hecate
text: And you all know, security

speaker: Hecate
text: Is mortals’ chiefest enemy.

speaker: Hecate
text: Hark! I am called. My little spirit, see,

speaker: Hecate
text: Sits in a foggy cloud and stays for me.

speaker: Hecate
text: O, well done! I commend your pains,

speaker: Hecate
text: And everyone shall share i’ th’ gains.

speaker: Hecate
text: And now about the cauldron sing

speaker: Hecate
text: Like elves and fairies in a ring,

speaker: Hecate
text: Enchanting all that you put in.
